intro: Dubouzetia guillauminii, commonly known as the Guillauminii bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. It is a perennial herb that produces showy blooms from late spring to early summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
